Package com.library.controller

Class LibrarianBookController

java.lang.Object
com.library.controller.LibrarianBookController
@RestController
@RequestMapping("/admin")
public class LibrarianBookController
extends java.lang.Object
Rest Controller for Admin(Librarian) for books related API mapping All requests must be prefixed with "/admin".
Author:
Shahrukh

  • Method Details

    • getAllBooks

      @GetMapping("books") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Book>> getAllBooks()
      Get all books, even those that are not available for Users, which means they are taken by some user.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity List of Book

    • getAllBooksByName

      @GetMapping("/books/{name}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Book>> getAllBooksByName​(@PathVariable("name") java.lang.String name) throws ResourceNotFoundException
      Search all books by name, even those that are not available for Users, which means they are taken by some user.
      Parameters:
      name - book name
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity List of Book
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - ResourceNotFoundException is a custom exception class which gets the ErrorDetails class

    • getAllBooksByAuthor

      @GetMapping("/books/author/{name}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Book>> getAllBooksByAuthor​(@PathVariable("name") java.lang.String name) throws ResourceNotFoundException
      Search all books by author, even those that are not available for Users, which means they are taken by some user.
      Parameters:
      name - book name
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity List of Book
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - ResourceNotFoundException is a custom exception class which gets the ErrorDetails class

    • createBook

      @PostMapping("books") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Book> createBook​(@RequestBody Book book)
      Save book which right now can only be done by Admin. See LibrarySecurityConfig
      Parameters:
      book - Book Object
      Returns:
      Book

    • createBooks

      @PostMapping("books-list") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Book>> createBooks​(@RequestBody java.util.List<Book> book)
      Save list of books all at once, which right now can only be done by Admin. See LibrarySecurityConfig
      Parameters:
      book - Book Object
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity List of Book

    • updateBook

      @PutMapping("books/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Book> updateBook​(@PathVariable("id") long bookId, @RequestBody BookDTO bookDetails) throws ResourceNotFoundException
      Update Book, by providing name, isbn and author. Other properties cannot be updated right now!
      Parameters:
      bookId - Id of book
      bookDetails - Book Object
      Returns:
      Book
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - ResourceNotFoundException is a custom exception class which gets the ErrorDetails class

    • getParams

      @GetMapping("params") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<ParameterMst>> getParams()
      Get all Params. What are Params? Params are default values that governs whole app. In here the default return days are 7. So they are params.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity List of ParameterMst

    • createParameter

      @PostMapping("params") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ParameterMst> createParameter​(@RequestBody ParameterMst param)
      Save the parameter data which contains default values.
      Parameters:
      param - ParameterMst object
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity List of ParameterMst

    • updateParam

      @PutMapping("params/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ParameterMst> updateParam​(@PathVariable("id") long paramId, @RequestBody ParameterMst paramDetails) throws ResourceNotFoundException
      Updates Parameter data (if Librarian wants to increase or decrease the return date.)
      Parameters:
      paramId - id of Parameter
      paramDetails - ParameterMst object
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity List of ParameterMst
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - ResourceNotFoundException is a custom exception class which gets the ErrorDetails class

    • getPendingBooks

      @GetMapping("books/pending/{username}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Book>> getPendingBooks​(@PathVariable("username") java.lang.String username)
      This gets the books are pending with users, just supply the username, and you will get the info.
      Parameters:
      username - user id of User
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity List of Book

    • returnBook

      @PutMapping("books/return/{id}") public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Boolean> returnBook​(@PathVariable("id") long bookId) throws ResourceNotFoundException
      If the user is kind enough to return book to the library, without torn pages or whatsoever, just give the book id, system will do the rest.
      Parameters:
      bookId - id of book
      Returns:
      Map returned or not?
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - ResourceNotFoundException is a custom exception class which gets the ErrorDetails class
